Title: the spaghetti catalyst

Penny: Oh, damn, they cancelled my Visa. Oh, yay, a new MasterCard!
What?
Okay. Are, are you hoping to get it telepathically?
God, can we please just say no longer seeing each other?
Okay, here’s the protocol, you and I are still friends, and you stop saying coitus.
Really?
Right.
Everyone.
Great.
So, how you been?
You’re just coitusing with me, aren’t you?
Mmm. How’s Leonard doing?
I’ll pretend I didn’t hear it.
Yep.
Interesting. I’ll have to have you over for spaghetti some night.
Oh. Um, okay. Why don’t you give me an hour and come over?
I don’t have hot dogs.
So, um, was Leonard okay with you coming over?
Well, good.
He’s been crying?
Oh, God, I feel terrible.
No. Why, do you?
Why did you ask if I had one, too?
All right. So, what’s new in your life?
Have you been running?
I’m so glad you like it.
Well, maybe that’s ’cause Leonard can’t cook.
Whatever. Ooh, I’m gonna get the cheesecake out of the fridge.
Oh, um, I, I can come back.
Yeah, I guess you’re right.
Nope.
Oh, oh, good, because, um, his mother called me.
Yeah, she wants me to take him shopping for sheets and towels.
Oh, well, then you, you do it.
Okay, you can take him for shoes.
Well, all I know is he says they hurt his feet.
Oh, no, no, no, a bunch of us from work are going to Disneyland next Saturday and Sheldon wants to come.
Well, he heard me making plans on the phone. Was I going to say no?
We’re going to Disneyland. He’s going to eat junk food.
Okay, whatever.
All right, got it. Is there anything else?
What’s the problem with Goofy?
We’re home.
How was I supposed to know that?
I know, I know.
No, you already threw up once. Go put on your PJs and brush your teeth.
Just go.
You’re welcome, sweetie.
Oh, um, I should probably get going.
Yep, okay.
Sheldon’s churro on my shoes.
He’s such an angel when he’s asleep.
I think we can do it.
No, be friends. You and me.
Good. I’m glad.
Good night, Leonard.
Sheldon: Uh-oh.
I was going to get my mail.
I think you mean telekinetically. And no, I just wasn’t sure of the proper protocol now that you and Leonard are no longer having coitus.
Well, we could if it were true. But as you live in the same building, you see each other all the time. The variable which has changed is the coitus.
Good, good. I’m glad we’re still friends.
Oh, yes. It was a lot of work to accommodate you in my life. I’d hate for that effort to have been in vain.
Just to be clear do I have to stop saying coitus with everyone or just you?
Harsh terms. But all right, I’ll just substitute intercourse.
Or fornication. Yeah. But that has judgmental overtones, so I’ll hold that in reserve.
Well, my existence is a continuum, so I’ve been what I am at each point in the implied time period.
Bazinga.

He seems all right. Although he does spend a disturbing amount of time looking at photographs of you and smelling the pillow you slept on. Oh, but now that I think of it, he asked me not to tell you that.
I’d rather you pretend I didn’t say it. I see you bought Mama Italia marinara spaghetti sauce.
That’s the sauce my mother uses. She likes cooking Italian because according to her, that’s what the Romans made Jesus eat.
I’m hungry now.
Will you cut up hot dogs into little chunks and mix them in with the sauce?
Oh, it’s all right, I do. Oh! You’re in for what my mother calls a real Eye-talian treat. (Enters apartment).
I was talking with Penny.
Is he making any progress? Because I’d like to erase Ben Affleck as Daredevil.
Which one picks last?
Well, usually I’m on the team that picks last. Unless there’s a kid in a wheelchair.
Well, of course I’m hungry. And as I have no plans to eat with any other team, I will consume my tangerine chicken with the appropriate gusto. Mm, mm, mm!
Just out of curiosity, do we still have hot dogs?
Just making dinner conversation. Go, Team Leonard!
Certainly. It’s not like I have to moderate my food intake because I’m planning on eating again very shortly. Mm, mm, mm!
Excuse me, I’m thirsty, so I’m going to go to the refrigerator and get myself a refreshing beverage.
Ah, I do so love beverages. Now I think I’ll take my after-dinner walk.

I read a study online that walking after a meal not only aids in digestion, but increases serotonin, and you know me, if there’s one thing I like more than a refreshing beverage, it’s serotonin. Bye-bye.
Oh, that’s not necessary. You can go first.
I can’t think of a reason why not.
Hold on. Nope, no reason.
All right, say hello to your mother for me.
What?
I didn’t say outside.
No, of course not. That would be odd and suspicious behavior.
Which way are you going?
I’m going the other way. Bye.
No. I mean, I have no idea what you smell.
Perhaps you’re getting a brain tumour.
I shall. Have a nice scoot.
Oh. Hello, doggie. Nice doggie. I bet you think you smell hot dogs. Look, a cat!

(Knock, knock, knock) Penny, (knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Long pause, knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Penny opens door. A dishevelled Sheldon is holding up one hot dog.) Here. I had to trade the others for my life.
Mmm, mmm, mmm. That’s Eye-talian.
Oh, yes. In fact, he said, I’m fine, I don’t care. And he in no way said it in a manner which would lead one to believe that he was covering up feelings of anguish and betrayal.
I’m also pleased to report that he’s all cried out over you.
Oh, I believe that was something else I wasn’t supposed to mention.
Do you have a stomach ache, too?
No.
Just making polite dinner conversation. Your turn.
Well, my new shoes are not made for running.
No. It’s just a suspicion I have. Mmm, mmm, mmm.
I do. Leonard never cooks for me.
You can’t cook and you made me this.
Oh, Lord, I’m in Jewish hell.
I told you, walking.
I got lost.
Satellites are down. Solar flares.
Yes, there are.
I’m sorry. I misspoke. What I meant to say was my battery died.
(Knock, knock, knock) Leonard, (knock, knock, knock) Leonard, (knock, knock, knock) Leonard.
Thanks for seeing me on such short notice.
Maybe this isn’t a good time.
Do you really think death threats are an appropriate way to begin this conversation? Sometimes your lack of social skills astonishes me.
You may want to sit down.
Point taken. You may want to sit up.
I’ve been seeing Penny behind your back.

We had dinner last night. She made me spaghetti with little hot dogs cut up in it. Well, little hot dog. I gave up the other five hot dogs to a real dog. A real, big dog. A hell hound. Tangential to the primary story. How about I circle back to it?
I told you, she made spaghetti with little hot dogs. I like spaghetti with little hot dogs.
I didn’t want to upset you. Howard made it very clear that my allegiance should be to male comrades before women who sell their bodies for money.
Yes, but I rephrased it to avoid offending the hos.
Oh. Well, so the emotional turmoil that’s been keeping me from achieving REM sleep was entirely unjustified?
Well then as my meemaw would say, looks like we butchered a pig, but nobody wanted bacon.
And now, as promised, the tangent. Sheldon and the Hell Hound, or How I Lost My Hot Dogs.
We stayed for the California Adventure water show. It was pure Disney magic.
It’s all right. I’ll see it again with you.
I can still eat.
Okay, but just don’t fight
Thank you, Penny.
Leonard: Hey, where you been?
No, no, it’s fine. I don’t care. I’m over it.
Sheldon, I got you your tangerine chicken. I hope you’re hungry.
Okay.
I don’t know. Why?
Do you want the last dumpling, Sheldon?
So, you guys want to do something tonight?
What about you, Raj?
I never stopped hanging out with you.
You know what? I’ll just spend the evening alone.
Since when do you take after-dinner walks?
Yeah?
Where you going with this, Raj?
So, go.
And you think my presence will help with that?
I’m not going out tonight, Raj.
Very much.
Don’t worry. You’ll meet a girl someday.
Yes, you will, and she’ll be beautiful, and kind and sexy and funny and everything you ever wanted in a woman.
I do, and you’ll fall hopelessly in love and give her your heart. And she’ll take it and grind it into pathetic, little pieces.
I’m pretty sure Martha Stewart never got naked with a room full of big, fat Japanese guys.
Hey, where you been?
For an hour and a half?
How could you get lost? Your phone has GPS.
What the hell was that about?
Oh, we really need to get you a girl.
Oh, just come in!
What do you want, Sheldon?
Tell me why you woke me up or I swear to God I will kill you.
What do you want?
I’m in bed!
Sheldon!
Okay, when you say seeing Penny, what exactly does that mean?
Fine. Why did you have dinner with Penny?
Then why did you have Chinese food with us?
Is it possible he said Bros before Hos?
Sheldon, I don’t care if you want to be friends with Penny.
Yes.
I guess not.
D-don’t be silly. We’re neighbours, we’re going to run into each other, may as well get used to it.
You used to it yet?
Me neither. Oh, Sheldon seemed think that I would be upset about you hanging out with him. But I just want you to know it’s fine.
His mother?
I was going to do that.
No, I don’t want to do it. You can do it.
I just took him for shoes.
Fine. I’ll take him for shoes next Saturday.
You’re taking him to Disneyland?
All right. But let me know if you’re going to stuff him with junk food. I don’t want to bring home a nice dinner for him and see it go to waste.
All I’m saying is give me a heads-up.
And don’t let him go on Space Mountain after he eats. He’ll say he can handle it, but I promise you’ll end up with churro puke on your shoes.
Yeah, don’t let Goofy near him. He’ll have nightmares and I’ll have to deal with it.
Wish I knew. He’s fine with Pluto.
It’s ten o’clock, where have you been?
I was going to see that with him.
And I have food here. You said you were going to call.
We’re not fighting.
Aren’t you going to thank Penny for taking you to Disneyland?
Want a cup of coffee?
Come on. It’s just a cup of coffee.
What am I smelling?
Yeah. Shame he has to wake up.
Smother Sheldon in his sleep? Wouldn’t that be wrong?
Oh. Sure. Absolutely.
Here’s an idea. I’m just throwing it out there, friends who have sex.
Kidding. Just a couple of friends goofin’ around.
Howard: What’s wrong with you? You can’t hang out with your roommate’s ex. That’s totally uncool.
So would Ben Affleck. The point is, in a situation like this you got to pick sides. You’re either on Team Leonard or Team Penny.
What?
Oh, God, this is good.
Jews don’t have hell. We have acid reflux.
Nah, I can’t. I got to pick up my mom from her water aerobics class. 18 overweight women flapping their arm fat in a swimming pool. Looks like the manatee tank at Sea World.
I wish you were Aquaman. Then I could send you to scoop my mom out of the old lady tank.
Yeah, since when do you take walks?
Hold on. I’ll walk down with you.
Or we could go together.
Let’s go.
Okay.
You said you were going for a walk.
So what, you’re just gonna walk up and down the stairs?
Which way are you going?
I parked my scooter down the block.
Bye. Actually, I’m this way. Do I smell hot dogs?
I definitely smell raw hot dog.
All right, have a nice walk.
You might want to stand back. I’m sitting on top of 13 horses here.
Well, that’s it. We’re officially out of things to talk about.
Raj: Yeah, he’s over it, that’s why he’s been whining all day about trying to invent that memory-wiper gizmo from Men in Black.
Let me ask you a question. Do you believe you’re going to go to hell for eating sweet and sour pork?
Oh, there it is, now that you don’t have a girlfriend, you want to hang out with me again.
Oh, please, we all know I’m the friend you call when you have no other options. If we were the Justice League, I’d be Aquaman.
What, suddenly I’m not good enough for you?
I’ve missed you.
Hey, Leonard?
I haven’t had sex in a year.
Don’t flatter yourself, dude. I want to go out and meet a woman.
Well, I need a wingman. I don’t want to come off like a lonely loser.
Well, I do. Next to you, I’ll look like a catch.
All right. Would you mind if I went to your room and downloaded some Asian pornography?
Doesn’t have to be Asian.
No, I won’t.
You really think so?
But we’ll have sex first, right?
Look at this. Do you think she’s really doing that or is it PhotoShop?
You don’t know that. Prison changes people.
There are no solar flares right now.
Dude, I’m an astrophysicist. If there were solar flares, I’d be all up in it.
I don’t know. Do you think this is really Hillary Clinton doing it with Oprah?
Hey, do you think the elastic woman in The Incredibles needs to use birth control or can she just be a diaphragm?
Howard (to Raj, who has whispered to him: Oh, yeah, the whole thing seems a little twisted to me, too.

Oh, oh, good, because, um, his mother called me.
Yeah, she wants me to take him shopping for sheets and towels.
I was going to do that.
Oh, well, then you, you do it.
No, I don’t want to do it. You can do it.
Okay, you can take him for shoes.
I just took him for shoes.
Well, all I know is he says they hurt his feet.
Fine. I’ll take him for shoes next Saturday.

I was going to see that with him.
How was I supposed to know that?
It’s all right. I’ll see it again with you.

Aren’t you going to thank Penny for taking you to Disneyland?
Oh, um, I should probably get going.
Come on. It’s just a cup of coffee.
